programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui boards a ferry to view a traditional cottage in Ventnor on the Isle of Wight, while Dion checks out an end terrace in Bradford, as well as following a two-year project in Derby to build eight homes on land formerly used as garages and workshops.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: As long as the water's warm, Clive loves to swim, so he's enthusiastic about taking a dip in the vast volcanic spring of Saturnia and discovering why Italians believe in the healing power of thermal water. Travelling on through Maremma - a big stretch of country running between Tuscany and Lazio - Clive stays in a treehouse at a lavender farm and learns how to extract oil from the plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Idées et conseils d'experts pour entretenir son jardin.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Join presenter Jo Coburn as she discusses the latest political news and stories in a conversational format, covering the comings-and-goings from Westminster in the BBC's daily politics programme. Featuring opinions and arguments from all the sides of the political spectrum, the show invites informed and opinionated guests to share their views on the stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Game show in which players must avoid giving impossible answers to a set of questions.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Teams from all over the UK battle to beat the formidable Eggheads.

programme.title: Un menu en or
programme.sub-title: Black Bear Burger and Naked Dough
programme.desc: Des cuisiniers et des restaurateurs tentent de faire la promotion de leurs recettes devant des investisseurs. Les plus audacieux et talentueux ouvriront leur restaurant. (VO : Million Pound Menu).

programme.title: Au coeur du cosmos
programme.desc: Saison 1 Episode 4 La lumière est étudiée sous tous les angles : son énergie, sa composition et sa vitesse, pour un voyage dans le temps, de la naissance du cosmos au big bang. Année de réalisation : 2011

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The finalists make a party dress and a jumpsuit before one is crowned the series winner.

programme.title: Flog It !
programme.desc: The Flog It! team visits the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich. Antique experts Mark Stacey and Jonathan Pratt find a varied collection of objects among the hundreds of visitors. Paul Martin takes a ride along the Thames on board an amphibious vehicle.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: The celebrities face their final quizzes, and the week's winner is crowned.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive takes on the star goal scorer for ACF Fiorentina's women's team in a penalty shoot-out. Back in the city, he indulges his passion for fashion - his mum Lynne was a seamstress for Burberry, and his first job was on Black Beauty and Hair magazine - by getting a masterclass in Italian menswear. Clive also discovers why italics are so Italian as he designs a wedding card for his niece Lucy.

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams sees rare birds, insects and lizards along the north-east Wales border.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Blooms, veggies and fruit all get the expert treatment at Beechgrove Garden this week.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Idées et conseils d'experts pour entretenir son jardin.

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: Rebuilding a Chinese bridge, saving a 450-year-old table, and a painting with a secret.

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob and Paul start the series by fishing the beautiful river Exe in Devon, looking for Grilse, also known as the 'summer silver'. After a day of limited success, they enjoy a game of cricket before having a go at some shore fishing at Bossington Beach in Somerset.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: MOTDx is a fun television show dedicated to football. Join retired footballer Jermaine Jenas and his football-loving friends, Craig Mitch, Chelcee Grimes and Reece Parkinson. They discuss everything about the English Premier League, including the latest news, teams, goals and skills, and talk to the biggest stars of the nation's favorite sport.

programme.title: Mission déco
programme.desc: The quarter-final challenge involves wedding accommodation on the banks of Rutland Water.

programme.title: Inside Taiwan: Standing up to China
programme.desc: Taiwan is at the heart of a struggle between two nuclear powers - China and the United States - and there are fears it will become the next global conflict. President Xi Jinping insists Taiwan is part of China and must re-unify with the motherland. But Taiwan's president, Tsai Ing-wen, says the island is already independent and must maintain its freedom and democracy. Jane Corbin investigates how the Taiwanese government and young people are fighting what they say is Chinese disinformation, cyber attacks and dirty tricks.

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc: Six presenters meet the people fighting to rebalance earth's failing ecosystems.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: This is BBC Two.
